snippet: Two movements have sprouted to fight for this generation’s right to move out of the parental basement.
abstract: Campaign for Young America and Fix Young America are new nonpartisan youth advocacy groups to help young people find jobs; April unemployment rate for workers under age 25 was 16.4 percent, compared with 8.1 percent over all, although employers say they will hire 10.2 percent more college graduates from the class of 2012 than they did from the class of 2011. Photos (L)
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON THIS may be little consolation to recent graduates who have sent out dozens of résumés with nary a response; who have been turned down for unpaid internships; who have vast amounts of student debt to repay as they continue in jobs as baby sitters and waiters.

headline.main: The Jobless Young Find Their Voice
